title: You Can Buy Bitcoin At A Discount, If You Trust The SEC To Be Rational
author: Steven Ehrlich
description: The clock is ticking on a limited-time offer to get bitcoin on the cheap. Whether it turns out to be a bargain depends on the actions of an intransigent regulator.

title: Leak Reveals BlackRock’s Game-Changing Bitcoin Plan That Could Cause Price Chaos For Ethereum, XRP And Crypto
author: Billy Bambrough
description: Mike Novogratz, the chief executive of crypto financial services company Galaxy Digital, has revealed his sources at two of the world's largest asset managers, expect a game-changing spot bitcoin ETF to be approved within the next six months...

title: Genesis, DCG Reach Bankruptcy Deal With Unsecured Creditors, But Gemini And Customers Won’t Play Along
author: Nina Bambysheva
description: Recoveries could reach 90% under new arrangement, which comes after Winklevoss fraud suit.

title: Forbes Blockchain 50 2023
author: Nina Bambysheva
description: Despite 2022’s crypto market collapse, dozens of enterprises around the world are still investing in blockchain, the distributed-database technology that underpins the entire sector because it helps their businesses operate better, faster or cheaper.

title: Digital Currency Group Flunks `Giggle Test’ In Court Case, Cameron Winklevoss Claims
author: Nina Bambysheva
description: Gemini President alleges DCG and CEO Silbert ignore reality after they claimed ‘character assassination.’

title: Bitcoin, Crypto Billionaires Lost $110 Billion In Past Year
author: John Hyatt
description: Some of the biggest losers of all, these billionaires lost over 75% of their wealth in just 12 months. Why it could get even worse as U.S. regulators and prosecutors take aim.

title: The ‘Most Important Thing’—‘Simultaneous’ $15.5 Trillion Crypto Earthquakes Are Heading For Bitcoin And Ethereum After XRP-Led Price Boom
author: Billy Bambrough
description: Crypto asset manager Grayscale has said it will take "any action necessary" to convert its flagship bitcoin fund to a fully-fledged U.S. spot bitcoin ETF—calling on the SEC to approve all ETF applications together...

title: Genesis ‘Has A Few Defenses’ Against $3.9 Billion Claim From FTX
author: Nina Bambysheva
description: New wrinkle in Genesis bankruptcy comes as some creditors balk at earlier agreement.

title: Gemini Pressures Digital Currency Group As Clock Runs Out On Genesis Loan
author: Emily Mason
description: Winklevoss twins are still willing to negotiate ‘in good faith’ but also ready court actions.

title: Customers Of Crypto Billionaires Winklevoss’ Gemini Plead For Lost Funds
author: John Hyatt
description: The Winklevoss twins promised “real return” for Gemini users who signed onto their lending program. Now customers are owed $900 million as the contagion that began with the collapse of Sam Bankman-Fried’s FTX crypto exchange spreads further.

title: Cracks At Kraken: Crypto’s Near Empty C-Suite
author: Steven Ehrlich
description: Founder Jesse Powell’s anti-establishment ethos helped fuel the company’s growth into a leading global crypto exchange. But as Kraken matured, Powell became a liability. His recent departure means there are now four empty offices in the exchange's top echelon.

title: Bitcoin Mining CEO Says Large Investors Are Angling To Enter The Industry This Crypto Winter
author: Steven Ehrlich
description: Bitcoin mining economics have never been this difficult. However, Foundry CEO Mike Colyer says that many mainstream investors see an opportunity.

title: American Express Announces First Crypto Rewards Credit Card On Its Network
author: Nina Bambysheva
description: The card, developed in partnership with crypto wealth manager Abra, will transact in U.S. dollars and offer crypto back on any purchase category and amount. The rollout is expected later this year.

title: Gemini Crypto Pauses Withdrawals, Fallout Continues From FTX Collapse
author: Q.ai - Powering a Personal Wealth Movement
description: What’s the latest Gemini crypto news? Well, Gemini recently announced they were pausing withdrawals, launching their own Trust Center, and what this means for crypto investors.

title: At Least 20 Billionaires Got Burnt By Sam Bankman-Fried And FTX Cofounder Gary Wang
author: Matt Durot
description: The FTX wonderkind and his cofounder are no longer billionaires. And the sudden collapse of their cryptocurrency exchange has hit the fortunes of at least 20 of the world’s richest people.

title: ‘In Huge Trouble’—Leak Reveals $10 Billion Earthquake Could Be About To Cause Bitcoin And Ethereum Price Chaos
author: Billy Bambrough
description: Fears are swirling that $10 billion bitcoin and crypto giant Digital Currency Group (DCG) could be in trouble...

title: Alameda And FTX May Have Taken Advantage Of Customers From The Start
author: Steven Ehrlich
description: FTT tokens at the center of collapse passed back and forth between the pair even before they were issued, according to research firm Nansen.

title: Bitcoin Mining’s First Major Bankruptcy Creates Uncertainty For Key Partners, Opportunity For Others
author: Colin Harper
description: Compute North, the second largest bitcoin mining hosting provider in the US, filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy last week. More are likely to follow.

title: ‘Groundbreaking’ Crypto Index 401(k) Opens Up $7 Trillion Market Beyond Bitcoin And Ethereum After Huge Price Crash
author: Billy Bambrough
description: Controversial plans developed over last crypto bull run to expose 401(k) retirement savings plans to the wild swings of the bitcoin price are being expanded to include a handful of smaller cryptocurrencies...

title: ‘Ready To Run’—Crypto Braced For A $10 Billion Earthquake As The Price Of Bitcoin, Ethereum, BNB, XRP, Cardano, Dogecoin, Polygon And Solana Soar
author: Billy Bambrough
description: Bitcoin﻿﻿ and other major cryptocurrencies have rocketed higher this week, adding almost $200 billion to the combined crypto market—with some betting the rally is just getting started...

title: Crypto Winter Watch: All The Big Layoffs, Record Withdrawals And Bankruptcies Sparked By The $2 Trillion Crash
author: Jonathan Ponciano
description: Another crypto lender is fending off forced liquidations, and more firms laid off hundreds of workers this week—marking the latest casualties of a bear market that continues to leave a path of destruction in the digital currency sector.

title: Bankman-Fried’s Media Apology Tour | BlockFi Bankruptcy
author: Crypto Confidential
description: Former FTX CEO has made multiple public appearances addressing the collapse of his companies.

title: Crypto Broker Voyager Digital Files For Chapter 11 Bankruptcy
author: Nina Bambysheva
description: Last week, the firm issued a notice of default to Three Arrows Capital (3AC) after the hedge fund failed to repay a loan worth more than $670 million.

title: Flow Launches $725 Million Blockchain Development Fund With A16z, Digital Currency Group And Other Investors
author: Nina Bambysheva
description: The fund launches amid reports that Instagram will soon pilot support for Flow-based NFTs.

title: Crypto Giant Genesis Files For Bankruptcy As Casualties Mount After FTX Collapse
author: Robert Hart
description: Cameron Winklevoss threatened to sue Genesis parent company Digital Currency Group and its CEO Barry Silbert to recover some $900 million he claims it owes customers of his crypto platform Gemini.

title: Solana, Coinbase On The Rise; Grayscale Ethereum Trust Discount Nears 60%
author: Nina Bambysheva
description: COIN gained nearly 13% after $100 million settlement announcement with New York.

title: Binance Pledges Up To $2 Billion To Bail Out Distressed Crypto Firms As FTX Contagion Spreads
author: Zinnia Lee
description: Binance, the world’s largest cryptocurrency exchange headed by billionaire Changpeng Zhao, is committing up to $2 billion to help support crypto firms facing financial hardships following the bankruptcy of rival exchange FTX.

title: As Gemini And Genesis Trade Barbs Over Failed Product, SEC Sues Them Both For Selling It
author: Mitchell Martin
description: U.S. attacks Earn program as unregistered securities while former partners fight and investors stew.

title: Why More Than 26,000 People Were Laid Off In The Crypto Sector This Year
author: Jack Kelly
description: Executives of cryptocurrency exchanges are bracing for a long, cold crypto winter characterized by layoffs. The reasons for concern include the cratering of crypto prices, the FTX debacle, an implosion of crypto platforms and higher interest rates.

title: Crypto’s Biggest Asset Manager Launches Bitcoin Mining Fund, Wants To Take Advantage Of Fire Sale Prices From Underwater Sellers
author: Colin Harper
description: The Grayscale Digital Infrastructure Opportunities LLC will invest in distressed Bitcoin mining assets – namely, Bitcoin mining machines. This new business line could also help offset deep struggles with its flagship bitcoin investment trust.

title: Billionaire Cameron Winklevoss Calls For Removal Of ‘Lying’ Barry Silbert, CEO Of Flailing Crypto Conglomerate DCG
author: Derek Saul
description: Winklevoss described a scheme in which Silbert “would print money for the DCG universe in perpetuity” via one of his crypto subsidiaries, a scenario awfully similar to that of fellow disgraced crypto emperor Sam Bankman-Fried.

title: Messari’s Mainnet Conference Two Weeks Later: Crypto Winter Has No End In Sight
author: Kenneth Rapoza
description: Mainnet attendees quietly bullish. Why to "Keep Calm and 'Hodl' On."

title: Bitcoin Prices Retain Bulk Of Gains After Climbing To 5-Month High
author: Charles Bovaird
description: Bitcoin prices have shown strength lately, holding on to most of their recent upside after rising to their loftiest value in over five months. The digital currency has been rising lately in spite of industry headwinds, including the FTX collapse and Genesis Capital declaring bankruptcy.

title: Crypto Winter Unwind Still Has Legs To Run And Run
author: Clem Chambers
description: The potential for contagion remains giant in most areas you look in the centralized segment of crypto.
